column4: im having a problem keeping ubuntu(8.04) working, i had it set up to dual boot (twice) with XP, but if i let my computer idle on ubuntu over night, i wake up to a black screen, and ubuntu will no longer load
what state is the system left in?
I meant, what things was the system doing when you left it functioning properly?
are you saying the system won't boot up again when powered-on?  or has the system gone into suspend but won't come out?
wow... that isn't normal at all.  Are Windows and Ubuntu on the same hard drive?
how are you getting it to boot into windows?
if menu.lst isn't found, then I'm kinda confused...
it sounds like you might have two copies of grub installed..  probably from both attempts at install
that's possible.  You could just be seeing the swap or maybe just the home
Windows isn't very good at seeing filesystems it doesn't know how to read.
Part of the boot process for Ubuntu involves a UUID for root being sent to the kernel..  That UUID being sent may be the wrong one if you have two grubs
devilsadvocate:  It's also possible that an EISA partition and BIOS masking of such would cause problems with loading GRUB
significantly
I have encountered one power-off problem with Ubuntu, but it's never caused a problem like that.
that's not to say it's impossible, just highly unlikely
just don't use wubi this time.  try it pure from CD
alternate if you're really paranoid
do you have a spare computer on your network?
you could set up a server to do RPL or PXE and load the setup that way
listen to devilsadvocate..
there's also install from a flash drive
repeated defragging can help and my be necessary.  but free up as much space as you can before defrag
